value.title: Dynamically find header rows and promote them in Power Query
value.excerpt: Dynamically find a column header and promote them in power query is  a very common requirement, specially if you are importing data from excel or pdfs for example.  In today's video, I will show you how to do that with just a few simple steps!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7LJ0EgTc4rU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Dynamically remove columns that contain a specific word in the header - Power Query
value.excerpt: It is very common when importing data from excel or pdfs that you get a lot of empty columns. In today's video I will show you how to remove those columns dynamically using power query.  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power

value.title: Insert blank rows at each category in Power Query
value.excerpt: Have you ever wanted to have a blank row after each category or subcategory, so you can visualize your data in a table? value.title: Insert text anywhere in a cell without adding a new column using the Power Query User Interface.

value.title: Show rows with no data - Power BI Tips & Tricks #33
value.excerpt: By default, column headings are only displayed in your reports if they contain data. value.title: 3 ways Reporting Services and Power BI work together
value.excerpt: With the release of Microsoft SQL Server 2016, I look at how Reporting Services and Power BI work together. From the Power BI mobile app, to pinning visualizations to a dashboard and how Reporting Services handles Power BI Desktop files.  #PowerBI #SSRS  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1
